name: Harbour Houses #7 Original Painting
description:
These small paintings are inspired by my many trips to seaside villages and towns over the years. I have had a long held fascination with the places we occupy, the places we come from.

The landscape art that I connect with the most is that which says ‘someone walked over this land, lived in these houses’ the relationship between people and the places we walk or reside in. The way humans have touched the land and depended on it and changed it, for better or for worse.

This series of paintings has been created using acrylics, inks and pencils and are loosely painted to give a feeling of the atmosphere of these beautiful haunting places.

Painted on 100% cotton watercolour paper and mounted in an ivory mount with backboard they are ready for framing. 

This painting is 7 x 10 inches plus mount.

name: Melody Takes Comfort in the Darkness
description:
This original work is painted with acrylics onto canvas board. It has many, many layers of glazes with gives it a haunting atmosphere and a luminosity more expected of an oil painting.

The piece is framed in a soft gold resin frame and measures approximately 23 x 19 inches including frame.

Please note that I am only able to mail this painting to a UK address. Due to the size and expense of the piece I can hand deliver to within 100 miles of Nottingham.

Should you wish any more images of the piece or more information then please contact me.

description:

The piece is framed in a dark brown resin frame and ivory mount and measures approximately 32 x 25 inches including frame.

Please note that I am only able to mail this painting to a UK address. Due to the size and expense of the piece I can hand deliver to within 100 miles of Nottingham.

description:
Print size - 9 x 13 inches 
Image size -

name: A Moment in Time - 2014 workshop deposit
description:
This is the deposit for the week long course set in Scotland in October 2014 - please do not purchase unless you are committing to paying for the remainder of the course in the allotted time.

Total cost of the course will be £625.00. Deposit is non refundable unless I can fill the place should you need to cancel.

Course registration documents/accommodation details/terms and conditions will be mailed out to the address listed on your paypal account - please make sure this is your current address.

Course Description

Imagine… a weeklong creative retreat in a peaceful hideaway on the East Coast of Scotland. Stunning views, walks on the beach, time to learn, time to relax, time to create to your heart’s content. Days spent exploring the area and working in a bright and airy studio with spectacular views and then evenings by the fireside in the company of other students.

During this week-long workshop you will …

…discover and be inspired by the beautiful local scenery, sea and sky and the quaint fishing village of Gardenstown

… spend time taking photographs and sketching outside

… learn expressive portrait making working from a model (to be confirmed)

… learn ways of placing a figure in a setting to bring narrative and storytelling into your work

… learn to paint with pastels, mixed media and paint

… work on extending your mark making techniques to create exciting atmosphere and variation in your work

… use pastels, collage, image transfers and paint to create expressive pieces with character and emotion

… in the first 3 days work on creating many drawings and sketches from which to create one or more finished pieces of work in the last 2 days of the class

The mornings will be spent learning new techniques and will feature several demonstrations and ways of working. The afternoons will be spent working in your own time to develop your drawing and sketching with the support of Gillian.

name: Small Painted Portrait - Georgette
description:
This is a small original acrylic painting on 100% cotton watercolour paper. Measuring 5 x 7 inches it has a small border for framing.

Painting is un-mounted and unframed for shipping.

Please note that colours may vary on depending on your computer screen.

name: Portrait Workshop - A gift like no other - Saturday 7th December 2013
description:
The principles of true art is not to portray, but to evoke.
Jerzy Kosinski 

A gift like no other

Date: Saturday 7th December 2013 
Time: 10.30am till 4.30pm 
Place: Focus Gallery in Nottingham – (further details available upon booking)

I am passionate about art and I love teaching and sharing art with others. I am now combining this together for you, in a gallery/studio setting, surrounded by art and inspiration. In a relaxed and informal way you will be helped to follow a journey into learning techniques and develop your own style to create art that translates your own character onto paper.

This session is aimed at those interested in creating a unique gift for a loved one – A portrait. Working from reference imagery we will find ways of drawing an expressive portrait of your choosing that portrays a likeness but also the character of the person from the photograph. Working in pastels you can add unique touches to the portrait to make it truly unique such as a favourite belonging or text. Whilst some drawing experience is helpful it is not absolutely necessary for this class.

Each day I teach is different and planned to suit the needs of the individual and the group. If you attend more than one class, as you progress you will be encouraged to follow your own interests and inspiration with my assistance and support in order to follow your own artistic journey.

Places are very limited to only 6 in a class to ensure you gain the support you need in a small group. This session is for Saturday 7th October 2013 from 10.30am till 4.30pm. Refreshments and cake are included but you will need to bring or purchase your own lunch.

Basic materials are included (paper, charcoal and student grade pastels) but there will also be a  materials kit available to purchase should you wish to carry on your work after the class (details also available on booking)

Please don’t hesitate to ask if you have any queries.

Feedback from previous classes...

"I can't recommend Gillian's workshops highly enough. Not only is her teaching style relaxed and full of inspiration but I will have no hesitation in taking any student as she is welcoming no matter what age or ability. Seeing my students come away with the same enthusiasm that I feel after being taught by Gillian is all I can ask, she is a gem! I really can't wait to book myself on another!"
Sarah Usher (Head of Art)

"I have been fortunate to do two of Gillian's workshops, and I have thoroughly enjoyed both. Gillian is a true inspiration, and is such a lovely lady. Her teaching methods are relaxed, and she believes in all of her pupils no matter what level they are at. In the two workshops, I learnt so many new techniques and skills" 
Heidi (art teacher)

name: Set of 4 greetings cards - Dreaming of a place
description:
This set of 4 high quality professionally printed greetings cards feature my artwork in beautiful pastel colours.

The place where you remember dreaming
Scattered to the four winds
The dim light
A moment in time

Each card measures 6 x 4 inches and is wrapped individually in a cellophane wrapper with a white envelope. 

Your order will be mailed Royal Mail first class for UK orders and Airmail for all other orders.
